Reviews.Title: Great camera with a couple notable issues
Reviews.Author: Jerald Wuorenmaa
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace a 2007 model Lumix (LS-70) that broke due to water damage.  This model is more advanced in some areas (more megapixels and longer zoom) but less advanced in others (no optical image stabilization [OIS]).  It was the latter point that was my main misgiving upon ordering the F2, but the lack of OIS so far has not seemed to be an issue.  I am still able to take sharp ISO 80-100 photos indoors with the flash or reasonable ambient lighting.Overall, pictures from this camera are very good and of higher quality than my last Lumix.  Colors are fairly accurate as long as white balance is set correctly.  Barrel distortion at wide angle, one of my pet peeves, is minimal.  Noise is kept at an acceptable level from ISO 80 through 200.  (I have not bothered to test higher ISOs as I would probably not use them.)Sharpness is very good in the central part of the image, especially at wide angle (35 mm equivalent being a respectable 33 mm), and even at 100% resolution for 5-megapixel images (I have little need for the 10 MP setting).  However, moving out toward the edges, problems begin to appear.  Severe blurring affects the right upper and especially lower corners at wide angle and extends to a lesser extent along the edgebetween the corners.  Along the bottom right edge, blurring extends into at least a third of the image.This may seem like a minor point, but it is noticeable in certain textures even at a much reduced resolution (less than full screen size for 4:3 images on a 17" widescreen monitor).  The best solution I can think of for this issue is to favor the upper left corner when framing the image, leaving the opportunity to crop out the right edge for a crystal clear and vivid image.  Blurring on the left side of the frame is minimal, and chromatic aberration does not present an obvious problem anywhere.Another issue I noticed right away is that the zoom control ring, which surrounds the shutter button, is flimsy and has a fair amount of play (not just in the ring itself, but back and forth movement of the entire ring/shutter button mechanism within the case), leading me to question its longeivity.  But Panasonic digital cameras are among the most reliable, so perhaps this fear is unwarranted.  At any rate, the zoom works fine in practice.Beyond the image concerns and the zoom lever, I love this camera.  It has an attractive appearance and lots of features including the ability to record widescreen VGA (WVGA) video.  Sound is provided for in videos, but HD resolution is not.  In still images, there is some opportunity for manual manipulation of camera settings including exposure compensation and ISO.  As for automatic settings such as Auto Scene Mode and Face Recognition, I have not used them yet but doubt they would play a role in my rating.  I will eventually get around to using specialized modes such as night scenery, though.  Finally, I have mixed feelings about the rechargeable battery.  All of my past cameras have taken AAs, which was nice in a pinch but also kind of a clunky system.I would hesitate to recommend this without qualifications due to the aforementioned issues, but based on my research and experience this camera has to be one of the best choices in the "entry level" price range.  I buy cameras at this level not because I am a beginner but because I don't have a lot of money to throw around, and so far I think it was a good choice.

Reviews.Title: Camera for Dummies!
Reviews.Author: FoodDiva "FoodDiva"
Reviews.Content: This camera is sooooooo easy to use!  It took me about an hour of playing around with this camera to find all the features (and more) that would meet my needs.  The pictures come out so beautiful with just a simple press half way to focus and shoot!  I've purchased more expensive cameras that gave me less than beautiful pictures (probably due to user error), but this camera is MUST I emphasize VERY EASY TO USE!  I'm sure my other cameras could have done the same thing, but they were more complicated and I'm sure I messed up the settings by playing around with it.There is a scene mode that allows you to take pictures in different settings (parties, snow, aerial views, indoor, night sky, babies, pets, etc.)  There is also the normal shooting mode which allows you to shoot in color, black and white, sepia.There is the coolest feature (i found) where you could shoot in bursts with or without flash...meaning...you hold the shooting button down and it takes continuous photos...like one of those flip books...so you don't miss any moment!  I don't know if my other cameras had this function...if they did...I could not find it.I am very satisfied with this camera!  So 5 stars for ease of use, and great quality photos with simple and easy to use modes!

Reviews.Title: Impressed with both photo & video quality
Reviews.Author: Yarii
Reviews.Content: I already own a more expensive Lumix camera so I know the great quality cameras that Panasonic builds - but I didn't want to carry my other camera around in my bag on a daily basis, so this DMC-F2 fits the bill for me.It is not fair to compare the two so I will just say I am impressed with this  camera, even though it does not have OIS like my other Lumix (optical image stabilization - helps with camera shake).  Truthfully, so far I cannot tell the difference in most instances.  But if OIS is a must-have for you, for a little bit more this Panasonic Lumix would be a better choice Panasonic Lumix DMC-FH1 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 5x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Black).Pros:>> Fast cycling - time between shots before it's ready again is about 1 second>> Takes good pictures, good contrast, although a little soft>> Burst mode - easy to change between one shot & burst mode via the quick menu button (lower right corner)>> Small & compact, but not too small that it's hard to grip, lightweight, easy to carry in your pocket if you want>> Black finish is matte, so it doesn't show fingerprints>> Lithium battery charges in less than 90 minutes and so far has not needed recharging and I've taken almost 275 pictures>> Movies are darn good for not being HDCons:>> Cheap plastic body, - the build quality is a little "iffy" for me - like the reviewer above who has the most helpful review votes, the entire zoom button moves back & forth, side to side in my camera also, like the hole was drilled too large, but it hasn't affected my ability to zoom in & out>> No optical image stabilization, most of the time it's not been an issue>> Not many manual controls, but you can't expect them at this price point>> Photo Fun Studio software isn't worth installing, Picasa is betterMovies!  I can't believe how great the video quality is, even though it's not HD.  I own a 3rd generation Flip MinoHD camcorder and this Panasonic camera takes better-looking videos.Movies are in the QuickTime format (software is included).I also want to note that you cannot zoom in/out while shooting a movie like most cameras of this price range.  But you can set the zoom before pressing the shutter to record.This camera uses a lithium battery, part number is CGA-S/106B, which is a 3.6V, 740 mAh 2.7Wh lithium-ion battery, in case you want a spare.  The battery is charged outside the camera in a separate included battery charger that plugs into the receptacle.This camera does have some internal memory, but on full 10 MP setting will only take 9 photos, so pick up an SD memory card.  I'm using a 4 GB Class 6 and this will hold 787 pictures at the 10 MP setting.This is a great case for this camera:  Lowepro Volta 20 Camera Case (Black)  Fits perfectly!

Reviews.Title: nice pics, but very fragile
Reviews.Author: stella
Reviews.Content: We were thrilled with the camera at first.  It took very nice pics and was easy to use.  However, after less than a month, the display went blank.  It still takes pics, but it is a blind point and shoot--Can't see the menu or anything that is needed to make selections either.  The unit was never dropped.  It was stored in an inside pocket of a purse.  It was working fine when it went in, but was blank when it was pulled out.  As I said, the purse wasn't dropped or anything; clearly the camera must of gotten knocked but there was no "oh-oh, there goes the camera" moment.  So I don't think this camera can handle normal day-to-day activity like other cameras can.

Reviews.Title: Good Simple Product
Reviews.Author: Marcial Cambronero
Reviews.Content: It does what it says, it has some solid company backup. A very nice Point-and-shoot. Nothing exceptional.The only big con i found is that it doesn't comes with an SD card and the internal space is to little.

Reviews.Title: lumix f2
Reviews.Author: juanfra
Reviews.Content: includes battery charger,usb cable, though  video cable to connect the camera directly to TV is not included.Very light and small. I Like the quality of the picture.

Reviews.Title: Great camera.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Noob
Reviews.Content: This has been my first camera. It has face detection which is great. When I put the pictures and videos into my computer they look great. The camera is light and it supports SD and SDHC cards. This camera is a steal.

Reviews.Title: DMC-F2K Point & Shoot
Reviews.Author: Harlow House "4site"
Reviews.Content: This low priced camera takes very good pictures and videos. Last Saturday I videoed a singing group for 20 minutes with this little camera after the smart card in my Canon S2-IS filled up. I wrote both files to a DVD and when played, I could not tell the difference in quality. Had it not been for the short gap in the one hour video, you would have thought it was a continuous shot with the same camera. The recorded sound was also equal in quality to that of the Canon.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Choice...
Reviews.Author: M. Urdaneta G
Reviews.Content: I Love this Camera... I have 2 years using it... excellent quality of pictures, user friendly, I recommend to buy another battery.. just in case you want to use it all day long.You Will need good illumination in the night.

Reviews.Title: PANASONIC DMC F2K LUMIX 10.1 MP CAMARA WITH 4X ZOOM
Reviews.Author: JOHNNY
Reviews.Content: Esta cámara, es portátil, saca fotos de buena calidad y nítidas, su cuerpo es plástico, y su zoom es normal para fotos caseras.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic
Reviews.Author: Fernanda Maria Pena "Nanda"
Reviews.Content: This are my second PANASONIC LUMIX. I JUST LOVE. so easy to use...so great quality. And the designer are just perfect..not too big or too small.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Yoma
Reviews.Content: great product! We had a different brand camera that took low quality pictures.  so far this camera has gone above and beyond our previous camera. The price was right too.

Reviews.Title: Fair
Reviews.Author: mythology101
Reviews.Content: The negative is I have to concentrate a little when I take a photo or it will be blurry. When you hold the button down a little before you take the shot makes a big difference. Gives it time to calculate what it needs to do. I took this camera to a wedding and I love where I could shut off all noise so not to disrupt the ceremony. I have a photo above (brick patio) to show an example. I like the camera but I wasn't prepared for the blurry photos. Has some neat settings like sepia tone for the old fashioned look. Nice that is has its own battery and charger. Very compact and light weight.As an update I'm dropping it a star.  I had the wedding photos printed out and a lot of them are a little grainy. The camera was set at 5mp. I'm not pleased.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic DMC-F2K Lumix Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: My.
Reviews.Content: Gold Box.  I purchased Panasonic DMC-F2K Lumix Digital Camera last October for my husband.  He has never been one to care for photography or videography, but when our daughter arrived more than 13 months ago, he started to capture a precious moment here and there of her each and every day with his iPhone.  I figured a no fuss point and shoot digital camera would be perfect for him.  This product met it's description/features, as well as, my expectations for a digital camera for my husband.  He enjoys it and uses it during special occasions and his iPhone for daily life.

Reviews.Title: I think I won je je je
Reviews.Content: When you buy something new and the price has been pretty good to you, sometimes you wish it had good things and performance. This product has been the best because definitely excellent (Quality, Pictures and so easy).

Reviews.Title: Pleasing Product
Reviews.Author: Grum
Reviews.Content: Camera was purchased as a gift for my son's birthday. I was pleased with the deal and he's pleased with the product. Recommended item.

Reviews.Title: Reasonable digital camera, decent value for the price, works best in natural light
Reviews.Author: Andi
Reviews.Content: I got this on Amazon's Daily Deal for $69 when I had been shopping around for a new digital camera. The price seemed cheap and while the reviews weren't stunning, they seemed good enough. I had checked out "more loved" digital cameras and at the time they all were priced significantly higher. I'm no expert but the camera seems fine, I've gotten some good photos from it- most of the best ones in natural light. When light is low, either the camera is slow to shoot (without flash) or the flash (also a bit slow) washes out my subject's face and creates a slightly unnatural looking picture. The menu and features navigation is easy enough but not genius.Don't forget to buy it with a memory card, it didn't come with one.

Reviews.Title: great gift
Reviews.Author: H. Cazares
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a gift for my dad, he wanted a P&S; camera, easy to use but with good picture quality. He loved it and got to try most of the features right away.

Reviews.Title: Good Product and Good Price
Reviews.Content: I think when you buy a Digital Camera (sometimes) you can think that the price is the most important beacuse the society has sold the wrong idea (high price = High quality) about products, I found in this camera good outcomes and I pay less. Anyway I recommend this Digital Camera.Good Investment.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic DMC-F2K Lumix 10.1MP Digital Camera with 4x Optical Zoom (Black)
Reviews.Author: Sergio Bautista
Reviews.Content: saludos ya me fue entregado como lo ofrecido . esta Panasonic DMC-F2K Lumix 10.1MP Digital Camera with 4x Optical Zoom (Black) es exelente

Reviews.Title: good for price
Reviews.Content: pic size is big but quality is not good especially in darkness.easy to handle & good for the price & brand.

Reviews.Title: Very light!
Reviews.Author: Yonna
Reviews.Content: Got this as a gift for my niece and i was wowww, it is very light and compact!!! Images are decent! Good camera on the go for his price!

Reviews.Title: Panasonic camera
Reviews.Author: J. Smith "deal maker"
Reviews.Content: I love this little jewel. Not expensive, but does a super job. Highly recommend. I've always been satisfied with Panasonic products.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix
Reviews.Author: Joni Zee "JoniZee"
Reviews.Content: Great gift for my son.  Of course, being 18, he dove right in and became a pro with it.  Awesome picture quality.  Very bright flash, so be prepared.  I reviewed a lot of cameras before deciding on this Panasonic. I was looking for good number of pixels and optical zoom with reasonable price and found all with this camera.  Video quality is also good; sound is good, clear and loud!  Having fun with it already.  Don't forget the memory card like I did!

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: teamass
Reviews.Content: Great for the price. easy to use. Just wish you could put AA or AAA batterys in it if these one die could buy a spare battery to use like I did but more money.

Reviews.Title: Great 1st time user camera
Reviews.Author: Marcia
Reviews.Content: This is my first digital camera and I love it.  It is very easy to use and takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great little point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Merridy Gersten "luvtoread"
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera.  Love the battery pack instead of batteries.  Picture quality is terrific.  The auto focus really brings great quality.  Very easy to use...Love the music while reviewing pics.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the money
Reviews.Author: John L "jl"
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for my kids to learn how to take pictures, with several use it turn out to be a better camera than I expected.  I own two other point & shoot cameras at $ 249/ea. I can't tell if the pictures are any better then this camera when looking at it.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for a point and shoot!
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: My canon sd600 died after 4 years and i couldn't afford to replace it with another canon. I found this for $69.99. I was iffy about buying a samsung camera, being a canon man my whole life but I am pleased to say I love this camera. Its auto settings are wonderful and it takes great pictures. It is easy to navigate and is slim and light. It feels a little less substantially built than many other small cameras I have owned, but the light weight is very nice to have. I would definitely recommend this to anyone who needs a budget point and shoot, but still wants a high quality picture.

Reviews.Title: Great Value for the price
Reviews.Author: Mohammed Alshammari
Reviews.Content: I love this Lumix, the quality of the picture is very good, very easy to use. only one thing i did not like about this camera, the material looks so cheep.

Reviews.Title: Get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: Bunyan10
Reviews.Content: I wanted a cheap digital camera for my trip to the U.S. Virgin Islands and that's exactly what I got.  The picture quality is acceptable and the camera is very easy to use if you just want to point and click; however, I was a little dissapointed that the flash didn't have an automatic sensor, or at least one that is easy to figure out.  This made for some lost opportunities during the trip.  Looking back I would suggest thinking about what you want to get from your pictures as an end result, because the means didn't justify the ends in this case.
